content.text:
# Kirigome ware

'' bottle, palace and landscape design, blue underglaze. Edo period, 19th century]]
Kirigome ware () is a type of Japanese blue and white pottery originally from Miyazaki, Miyagi Prefecture in the T≈çhoku region of northern Japan.
The origins of Kirigome ware are not completely clear, but date back to between 1844 and 1860 in the Edo period.

External links
* http://www.pref.miyagi.jp/soshiki/shinsan/11kirigome.html
